intro: Agathyrsus tataricus, commonly known as the Tatarian agathyrsus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Agathyrsus tataricus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
